column4: I was experimenting with galeon, tor, and privoxy... set galeon to use localhost:8118 as proxy, now gnome-terminal is using it too... even though I have unset the proxy, uninstalled galeon, and rebooted
anyone know how to get gnome-terminal to stop using the proxy?
find out where it's set with 'grep http_proxy /etc/*' (probably /etc/environment)
everything returned by that command is either a flag "--http-proxy" or on a line commented out
then the setting must be in your home directory -- probably $HOME/.bashrc
make sure you use the understroke (http_proxy)
I've been using Linux for years, never come across anything like this before
any likely candidates for a proxy variable setting?
I set the wgetrc to explicitly not use the proxy, and I can install things again
but it's still being set somewhere, I will have to do some digging!
